Issues.Title: Optimize the use and judgment of NODE_ENV
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Uniform processing and judgment of Node env

### What does the proposed API look like?
```js
export const isProduction = process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production';
export const isNotProduction = !isProduction;

```

Issues.Title: Module Federation & Vue 2 SSR: support async initialization
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
In order for Module Federation to work correctly, it requires a bootstrap entry file that serves as an asynchronous boundary between the host and the remote code. This way *It will split out the initialization code of a larger chunk to avoid any additional round trips and improve performance in general*. (Read more in: [the issue in module-federation](https://github.com/module-federation/module-federation-examples/issues/375#issuecomment-707442224), [webpack documentation](https://webpack.js.org/concepts/module-federation/#troubleshooting) and [a blog post](https://dev.to/waldronmatt/tutorial-a-guide-to-module-federation-for-enterprise-n5#host)).

When we try this concept in Vue 2 (latest version, 2.6.14), during SSR, vue-server-renderer will complain as it expects the module export to be a function, regardless of whether it will run it in a new context or not (`runInNewContext`).

See below commit (over the vue-hackernews example project) where the issue is minimally reproduced: The server entry will simply export the function creating the app instance through an import, instead of exporting it directly: https://github.com/tameraydin/vue-hackernews-2.0/commit/074192d9da26f8d78c742acb4328468edb19806c

### What does the proposed API look like?
There would be no need to introduce any new API or a breaking change. We would like vue-server-renderer to support also such async initializations; in other words, to accept also `Promise` (e.g. `import`) type of exports which would then resolve to a function that it currently expects, so that the Module Federation & SSR can be fully achieved in Vue 2.

We have solved this in our local fork (through a small refactoring over [createBundleRunner](https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/src/server/bundle-renderer/create-bundle-runner.js#L91)) with proper testing and are happy to open a pull-request - but of course, we would like get your feedback first.

_**PS**. I created a draft PR in case it provides a better context._

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Module Federation & Vue 2 SSR: support async initialization" (#12511)

Issues.Title: Render with contenteditable makes duplicated text
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.14

### Reproduction link
[codepen.io](https://codepen.io/toshirin/pen/GROapeK)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Go to: https://codepen.io/toshirin/pen/GROapeK
2. Type something to text box.
3. Duplicated text appears.

It may happen when initial text is empty("").If there is some text in the initial text, it doesn't happen.

### What is expected?
No duplicated text is displayed.
Display the text same as I was typed.

### What is actually happening?
Duplicates text which was not typed by me is appeared.

---
In my investigation, I found updateChildren()'s addVnodes()(see below) causes this.
https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/src/core/vdom/patch.js#L470
During the issue is occuring, the debbuger says:
```
oldCh=[];
newCh=[<vnode>]; (which includes typed text)
oldStartIdx=0;
oldEndIdx=-1;
```
So L468's condition `oldStartIdx > oldEndIdx` seem to be true.
But I don't know how I fix.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Render with contenteditable makes duplicated text" (#12496)

Issues.Title: Allow inferring types from Vue.set(object, ...) pattern
Issues.Body:
Right now it's not possible to infer the type when doing Vue.set this is because Vue assumes it to be a generic object. But with a small change we can allow these types to be inferred in a clear and consistent way similar to how it's array inference works. As an added benefit it also allows autocomplete of Vue.set().

This does however disallow setting brand new properties on objects. Although setting new properties on objects/classes which aren't previously defined in Typescript can be an anti-pattern.

### [Playground link](https://www.typescriptlang.org/play?#code/CYUwxgNghgTiAEBzCB7ARlC8DeBYAUPPJFAM6nwBqArgnoUfKQC5TMCWYTIzAPACoA+ABToAVuGYAueOMkAaeAGsQATxksY7AHaJ4AH3jbqAWzQgYigG6ZaM--DhKF8pHZKJ8AUpPJyONMUpZMvVfL8gS5VN1dIZBtZZI5mrN3OyJpOguFdxgD3FqjuNqNwwDcUuKE9OD6QA)

If adding a **new feature**, the PR's description includes:
- [ ] A convincing reason for adding this feature (to avoid wasting your time, it's best to open a suggestion issue first and wait for approval before working on it)

**Other information:**

As the esm and npm exports fields are gradually standardized, more and more tools will implement specific functions, such as importmap, according to these specifications.

[jspm](https://jspm.org/) is a tool that automatically generates importmap. It mainly generates importmap source map through the exports field of package.json. 

https://ga.jspm.io/npm:vue@2.6.14/dist/vue.runtime.esm.js This is an example of it and we can access it. But if we need to use it in the browser, we need to visit https://ga.jspm.io/npm:vue@2.6.14/dist/vue.esm.browser.js. 

This is currently not possible, so we need to configure `{ "./dist/*": "./dist/*" } ` essed in [jspm](https://jspm.org/)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "chore: Improve npm package specification" (#12501)

Issues.Title: 若依前后端不分离项目中，如何使用vue
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
若依前后端不分离版本，想用element-ui组件库，则需要引入vue.js依赖。
index.html 通过点击左侧菜单，来控制右侧内容显示。右侧内容为一个个html页面，以iframe的方式内嵌，点击菜单时，控制对应iframe的显示与隐藏。
如果要在这样的项目中使用vue,在每个需要element-ui组件库的html页面中，都要使用new Vue({el: '#demo1', data() {...}})吗？（注：这种写法已试，element-ui组件可正常使用）
若每个页面都new Vue这种方式不对，请问正确的写法是什么？
是在需要使用element-ui组件库的html页面中，分别使用new Vue({el: '#demo1', data() {...}})吗？若不是，正确的要怎么写呢？

### What does the proposed API look like?
在需要使用element-ui组件库的html页面中，分别使用new Vue({el: '#demo1', data() {...}})吗

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "若依前后端不分离项目中，如何使用vue" (#12500)

Issues.Title: No error handling for importing a component with the same name as the component you are importing into
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.11

### Reproduction link
[/nostalgic-turing-0p8v50 @ codesandbox.io](https://codesandbox.io/s/nostalgic-turing-0p8v50?file=/src/App.vue)







### Steps to reproduce
It is fairly easy to reproduce. You just need to create two components with the same name and import one into another.

The problem is trivial but in heat of development when one is doing a lot of work when this happens the error messages in the console are not very helpful. 

I am new to Vue, if you direct me to the proper area of code/module/subproject where it should be resolved I might attempt to resolve this myself and propose a patch.

Vue is a very good project.

I am @yodahack at github please contact me if need be.

### What is expected?
Plain Simple Error message during compilation phase or Plain Simple Error message during the execution phase.

### What is actually happening?
a dump of errors "Maximum call stack size exceeded"

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "No error handling for importing a component with the same name as the component you are importing into" (#12499)

Issues.Title: Vue.extend方法中的cachedCtors感觉实际没有起到缓存构造函数的作用
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.14

### Reproduction link
[github.com](https://github.com/vuejs/vue/issues/new/choose)







### Steps to reproduce
我看vue源码中的Vue.extend方法中有这么一段代码，目的是判断当前constructor是否在缓存中，如果在则从缓存中取，从extendOptions._Ctor中获取缓存列表这行代码，我看整个vue源码中只有此处有用_Ctor ，但是并没有复制，那是不是意味着每次走到这里获取到cachedCtors 都是空对象，无法走到下面的if分支中去呢？

var cachedCtors = extendOptions._Ctor || (extendOptions._Ctor = {});
      if (cachedCtors[SuperId]) {
        return cachedCtors[SuperId]
      }

### What is expected?
extendOptions._Ctor 应该有个地方赋值

### What is actually happening?
extendOptions._Ctor没看到有地方赋值

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Vue.extend方法中的cachedCtors感觉实际没有起到缓存构造函数的作用" (#12493)

Issues.Title: Firefox: Parent anchor tag link is opened, even though child input stops event propagation
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.14

### Reproduction link
[codepen.io](https://codepen.io/PremierJoe/pen/VwrqwLw)







### Steps to reproduce
- create an `<a>` tag with a child element of a checkbox input
- on the click event of the checkbox, stop event propagation
- console log on each input event
- click input
- on Chrome and Firefox, `<a>` correctly does not fire a click event. Link is not opened on Chrome, but is on Firefox.

### What is expected?
- Both Chrome and Firefox check the checkbox and do not click on the `<a>` element

### What is actually happening?
On Chrome, checkbox is checked and link is not opened

On Firefox, checkbox is checked and link is opened

---
On both, the event propagation seems to be working correctly (i.e. `<a>` click not logged to console) however the link is still opened on firefox

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Firefox: Parent anchor tag link is opened, even though child input stops event propagation" (#12490)

Issues.Title: serverPrefetch's `this` type doesn't include component properties
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.6.14

### Reproduction link
[codesandbox.io](https://codesandbox.io/s/vue-typescript-example-forked-yvrrbl?file=/src/App.vue:473-560)






### Steps to reproduce
Comment the `helloWorld` method, then uncomment it. This will trigger the type checking.

You should now see this syntax error on serverPrefetch code:
![Screenshot 2022-03-01 at 19 17 18](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1819575/156225764-15f2d064-f73b-44c3-835b-202f4d784f39.png)

### What is expected?
methods, props and data properties should be available inside serverPrefetch's `this` type.

### What is actually happening?
`serverPrefetch`'s `this` is a generic Vue type that doesn't include current component info.

---
This seems to be a leftover. This issue was fixed for multiple ComponentOptions with [this commit]( https://github.com/vuejs/vue/commit/db138e2254d71f6b96e033acf66ba43ad269841a#diff-3cd76992dbf6767bbb6b03890cd0173c9602172b7d6b8cb5b05703164b583c38L34-L42).

Then `ssrPrefetch` was added including the `this: V` type with [this commit](https://github.com/vuejs/vue/commit/d7a533d6f85aae52aed03202fa5ccb774f0cb2ec#diff-3cd76992dbf6767bbb6b03890cd0173c9602172b7d6b8cb5b05703164b583c38R99) and further `serverPrefetch` kept it [this commit](https://github.com/vuejs/vue/commit/42fdf3f8378e5dc379808a4fa67b39c4a74ae191#diff-3cd76992dbf6767bbb6b03890cd0173c9602172b7d6b8cb5b05703164b583c38R99).

This type is not needed:

```diff
diff --git a/types/options.d.ts b/types/options.d.ts
-  serverPrefetch?(this: V): Promise<void>;
+  serverPrefetch?(): Promise<void>;
```

I got to this bug trying to use a Vuex mapped mutation inside serverPrefetch.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "serverPrefetch's `this` type doesn't include component properties" (#12488)

Issues.Title: Export RouterLink and RouterView component
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?

https://github.com/vuejs/create-vue using local component registry in vue 3 template.
 
see https://github.com/vuejs/create-vue-templates/blob/284fcf591115e5cf39e4461e2fd4cd2c5ea009bb/typescript-router/src/App.vue#L2

```ts
import { RouterLink, RouterView } from 'vue-router'
```

We can import RouterLink and RouterView in vue-router v4

I think we should also export it in vue-router v3 . 

It will help typescript users and jsx users a lot. We can get better type information with this.

And also, we use lint rule https://eslint.vuejs.org/rules/no-undef-components.html

```js
{
    'vue/no-undef-components': [
        'error',
        {
            ignorePatterns: [
                /**
                 * Waiting for vue-router
                 */
                'RouterView',
                'RouterLink', 
            ],
        },
    ]
}
```

If vue-router v3 can export  RouterLink and RouterView, we can simplified configuration.

### What does the proposed API look like?
```ts
import { RouterLink, RouterView } from 'vue-router'

const { RouterLink, RouterView } = require('vue-router')
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Export RouterLink and RouterView component" (#3729)

3 links have same href

3 links have different href

Issues.Title: regexp is not applied when name is specified
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.5.3

### Reproduction link
[github.com](https://github.com/fumifumitaro/bag-vue-router)







### Steps to reproduce
```
{
  path: "/user/:user_id(\\d+)",
  name: "User",
  component: "UserComponent"
}
```

I defined route like this.

```
router.push('/user/abc')
```

This successfully returns a 404 error.

```
router.push({
  name: 'User',
  params: {
    user_id: 'abc' // similarly when null
  }
})
```

regexp do not apply in this case, and UserComponent is displayed.



### What is expected?
regexp should be applied

### What is actually happening?
regexp is not applied when name is specified

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "regexp is not applied when name is specified" (#3724)

]

setTimeout(function(){
    testProps  = { newsletterPopup: false };
},1000)


问题   Promotion 组件内如何监听    newsletterPopup  的变化

Release notes

Sourced from axios's releases.

v0.21.2

0.21.2 (September 4, 2021)

Fixes and Functionality:

  • Updating axios requests to be delayed by pre-emptive promise creation (#2702)
  • Adding "synchronous" and "runWhen" options to interceptors api (#2702)
  • Updating of transformResponse (#3377)
  • Adding ability to omit User-Agent header (#3703)
  • Adding multiple JSON improvements (#3688, #3763)
  • Fixing quadratic runtime and extra memory usage when setting a maxContentLength (#3738)
  • Adding parseInt to config.timeout (#3781)
  • Adding custom return type support to interceptor (#3783)
  • Adding security fix for ReDoS vulnerability (#3980)

Internal and Tests:

  • Updating build dev dependancies (#3401)
  • Fixing builds running on Travis CI (#3538)
  • Updating follow rediect version (#3694, #3771)
  • Updating karma sauce launcher to fix failing sauce tests (#3712, #3717)
  • Updating content-type header for application/json to not contain charset field, according do RFC 8259 (#2154)
  • Fixing tests by bumping karma-sauce-launcher version (#3813)
  • Changing testing process from Travis CI to GitHub Actions (#3938)

Documentation:

  • Updating documentation around the use of AUTH_TOKEN with multiple domain endpoints (#3539)
  • Remove duplication of item in changelog (#3523)
  • Fixing gramatical errors (#2642)
  • Fixing spelling error (#3567)
  • Moving gitpod metion (#2637)
  • Adding new axios documentation website link (#3681, #3707)

  • Adding documentation for the type guard isAxiosError (#3767)
  • Adding explanation of cancel token (#3803)
  • Updating CI status badge (#3953)
  • Fixing errors with JSON documentation (#3936)
  • Fixing README typo under Request Config (#3825)
  • Adding axios-multi-api to the ecosystem file (#3817)

Issues.Title: Matcher is linear and uses too many regex
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
The matcher implementation always use path-to-regex lib. It is too much for static paths, where it is possible to just compare strings.

Also, the implementatioin is O(N), if you have 100 routes and want to match the last one (that is static), you run 100 regex tests.
Regex is around ~10x slower than a simple string match and with a lookup table it is O(1).

https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/5d7afbe25f6b212bd4adb8344da72f6227a5c6d2/src/create-matcher.js#L85-L89


### What does the proposed API look like?
The API don't change, it is just optimization.

I did a draft PR #3707 to show the idea.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Update Testing Actions Documentation to No Longer Reference `inject-loader`
Issues.Body:
Hi,

This PR removes references to `inject-loader` from the Testing Actions section.  `inject-loader` is no longer working/supported, based on this issue: https://github.com/vuejs/vue-cli/issues/947

I fell into the same trap (that others have expressed in that ticket) of trying to get my tests to work following the example code, but only to find out that the `inject-loader` example code no longer works.

I hope that by removing the example code that doesn't work, it can save other newbies like me some time.

I also added a Jest example in case that can be helpful to others.

Sorry if this PR is not the right format.  I tried to follow the contribution guidelines, but could not find a version 4 branch or a `dev` branch in the repo.

Please let me know if there's anything else I should modify.

Thanks for building such a great product and providing well-written documentation. 🙏
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Update Testing Actions Documentation to No Longer Reference `inject-loader`" (#2155)

Issues.Title: Update documentation to mention maintenance/EOL/etc
Issues.Body:
### Version
4.0.2

### Reproduction link
[https://vuex.vuejs.org/](https://vuex.vuejs.org/)







### Steps to reproduce
According to the Vue.js documentation, Vuex is no longer being worked on. As documented here, https://vuejs.org/guide/scaling-up/state-management.html#pinia, it says:

"With Pinia serving the same role in the ecosystem, Vuex is now in maintenance mode. It still works, but will no longer receive new features."

However, nothing on Vuex's main page (https://vuex.vuejs.org/) states this.

### What is expected?
I would add something with a highlight of some sort, close to the top of the homepage, that makes it clear Vuex is no longer being updated. 

### What is actually happening?
It doesn't say this.

---
This form requires a URL that links to a reproduction of the bug. However I'm reporting an issue with documentation. Perhaps this form should be updated to clearly state how someone reports a doc bug?

Issues.Title: docs: update jsfiddle link
Issues.Body:
## Why
Jsfiddle application in the getting started section of the version `3.x` of vuex is not working because generic links are used which point to latest versions: `vue@4` and `vuex@3`.

## What changes 
The new fiddle link simply changes the cdn links to point to `vue@3` and `vuex@2` instead.
Concretely, the links changed are:
- https://unpkg.com/vue -> https://unpkg.com/vue@2
- https://unpkg.com/vuex -> https://unpkg.com/vuex@3

## Result
The demo application works again. Check it out:
- Old jsfiddle : https://jsfiddle.net/n9jmu5v7/1269/
- New jsfiddle: https://jsfiddle.net/ywpudorb/

Issues.Title: Changes to typescript overloads in Store instance methods.
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.6.2

### Reproduction link
[codesandbox.io/s/umtsos](https://codesandbox.io/s/umtsos?file=/src/store/index.ts)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Look up the Union type of the 'path' argument (initModule method)

2. An error appears about the incompatibility of the types of arguments for the registerModule method, the typing of this method does not support the use of the Union type:` string | string[]`

3. Familiarize yourself with the typing of this method by reference and match the union type to the two method declarations:
https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/blob/3.x/types/index.d.ts

For more information, use the resource:
https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/declaration-files/do-s-and-don-ts.html#use-union-types

### What is expected?
Support Union type: string | string[] given the already described type overloads of the registerModule method, the following errors will be eliminated when resolving the conflict:

```
1. Argument of type "string | string[]" is not assignable to parameter of type "string[]".
2. Argument of type "string | string[] is not assignable to parameter of type "string".
```

### What is actually happening?
When comparing the type "string | string[]", an error about type incompatibility is thrown, but given the type overloads, it should be possible to put an argument with the union type.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Easy two-way binding between v-model and vuex?
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Is there any solution for quick low-/no-overhead databinding to something like a store object? Implemented? Library suicide pact?

All this boilerplate code just to set up two-way data binding is abomination.Maybe it's too late already, looking at popularity graphs. Anyone that watches a tutorial on databinding with vuex will surely have puked and ran away. It's a shame. 

If there is no better concept, just create all these mindless getter setter and mutator methods IMPLICITLY unless definedI. I perhaps fail to understand how that is not better in any case (if properly communicated that this happens).

I think C# does something similar:

C# property sample:
`public int Age { get; set; } `

Is the **same** as:
`private int age;`
`public int Age`
`{`
 `   public get { return this.age; }`
`    public set { this.age = value; }`
`}`


Btw, if you want read only, in C# you can make the setter private for example:
`public string Age { get; private set; }`

Works since 2012 or so. But what do they know about creating a popular language.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Simply generate the default boilerplate getter setters and mutations (on build),  if the user doesn't define any.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Easy two-way binding between v-model and vuex?" (#2141)

Issues.Title: It is possible to sync vuex state across devices?
Issues.Body:
<!--
IMPORTANT: Please use the following link to create a new issue:

  https://new-issue.vuejs.org/?repo=vuejs/vuex

If your issue was not created using the app above, it will be closed immediately.
-->

when the user logs in,
i'm storing some data from an api on vuex , on page reload if the same user access i skip the API call and show vuex data.

this was going fine.

until i found out that if i'm logged in on multiple devices and update vuex, only the store of the updated device changes..

is there a way to sync vuex with latest update on all devices?

please help. thanks!
